meanings.definition: To change the direction or position of something
meanings.sent1: She needed to reorientate the map to find the correct way.
meanings.sent2: After getting lost, he had to reorientate himself to the right path.
meanings.sent3: Trying to reorientate a stubborn cat can be quite a challenge.
meanings.sent4: The new manager had to reorientate the team towards a more efficient workflow.
meanings.sent5: The compass needle always reorientates itself to point north.

meanings.definition: To adjust or adapt to a new situation or environment
meanings.sent1: He had to reorientate his thinking to understand the new concept.
meanings.sent2: Moving to a different country forced her to reorientate her lifestyle.
meanings.sent3: The robot had to reorientate its sensors to detect the new obstacles.
meanings.sent4: In order to succeed, she knew she had to reorientate her goals.
meanings.sent5: The students had to reorientate themselves to the school's strict rules.
